generif.text: Gene-profiling experiments of breast cancer cells infected with wt p53 revealed both MASPIN and desmocollin 3 (DSC3) to be p53-target genes, even though both genes are silenced in association with aberrant cytosine methylation of their promoters

Lss of DSC3 expression is a common event in primary breast tumor specimens, and DSC3 gene silencing in breast tumors is frequently linked to aberrant cytosine methylation and concomitant changes in chromatin structure.
Increased Dsc3 protein is associated with colorectal cancer

results suggest an abnormal expression of Dsc3, Dsg3, & beta-catenin induced in the progression of oral carcinomas & that Dsc3 expression level might be related to the regulation of beta-catenin in lymph node metastasis and cell proliferation in OSCCs.
Desmocollin-3 was expressed in almost half of the undifferentiated large-cell cancers
Both the binding of desmocollin 3 (Dsc3) to plakoglobin and Dsc3 phosphorylation are involved in Dsc3 binding to desmoglein 3 (Dsg3) during Ca2+ -induced desmosome assembly.
loss of heterophilic Dsc3/Dsg1 binding may contribute to pemphigus skin blistering
a human desmocollin-3 (DSC3) nonsense mutation underlies hereditary hypotrichosis and recurrent skin vesicles

Meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Autoimmunity to DSC3 in Pemphigus vulgaris.

These findings demonstrate that IgG autoantibodies against an additional component of the desmosomes, Dsc3, induce loss of keratinocyte adhesion and thus may contribute to blister formation in pemphigus.
Methylation status of DSC3 DNA is a prognostic marker for colorectal cancer. P53 appears to have an important role in regulating DSC3 expression.

High expression of desmocollin 1 (DSC1) was observed in 41.6%, DSC2 in 58.0%, DSC3 in 61.4%, E-cadherin in 71.4%, CDX2 in 58.0%, PITX1 in 55.0%, CDK4 in 0.2%, TLE1 in 1.3%, Factor H in 42.5%, and MDM2 in 0.2% of colorectal carcinomas.
The p53 target gene desmocollin 3 acts as a novel tumor suppressor through inhibiting EGFR/ERK pathway in human lung cancer.

The data show an important role of physiologically occurring transcript d2-d4 in normal brain function. Interference with this role by DSC3 is a likely pathological mechanism in X-chromosomal dystonia parkinsonism syndrome
Low expression of DSC 1, 2, and 3 was observed in 55, 54, and 79 % of liver metastases.
data suggests that DNA methylation contributes to down-regulation of DSC3 in prostate cancer, and loss of DSC3 predicts poor clinical outcome.
Suggest that Dsc3 can mediate FSH-induced ovarian cancer cell proliferation by activating the EGFR/Akt signaling pathway.
Napsin-A, and Desmocollin-3 were sensitive and specific markers for the diagnosis of AC and SCC, respectively. Both markers allowed classification of 54/60 cases into either AC or SCC.
The Findings of this study imply early alteration of the substantia nigra in XDP mutation carriers prone to develop parkinsonism.

Data show that fetal pMSCs (mesenchymal stromal cells) expressing the highest levels of desmoglein 2, desmocollin 3 and plakophilin 2, followed by maternal pMSCs, while bmMSCs expressed the lowest levels.
DSC3 suppresses colorectal cancer cell growth through inhibition of AKT pathway and regulation of E-cadherin
Autoantibodies to DSC3 in Pemphigus Exclusively Recognize Calcium-Dependent Epitope in Extracellular Domain 2.
Two cases of Hallopeau-type pemphigus vegetans with anti-desmoglein 1 and anti-desmocollin 3 antibodies without mucosal involvement.
Upregulation of Anti-Desmocollin 3 Antibodies in Pemphigus Diseases: A Case-control Study.

BP.term: homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion molecules

name: desmocollin 3
summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a calcium-dependent glycoprotein that is a member of the desmocollin subfamily of the cadherin superfamily. These desmosomal family members, along with the desmogleins, are found primarily in epithelial cells where they constitute the adhesive proteins of the desmosome cell-cell junction and are required for cell adhesion and desmosome formation. The desmosomal family members are arranged in two clusters on chromosome 18, occupying less than 650 kb combined. Mutations in this gene are a cause of hypotrichosis and recurrent skin vesicles disorder. The protein can act as an autoantigen in pemphigus diseases, and it is also considered to be a biomarker for some cancers. Alternative splicing of this gene results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2014].
